article_title: Roughly Speaking: Supreme Court battle, Bernie Sanders' surprising campaign (episode 53)
article_text:
Mitch McConnell and the Republican candidates are talking about making the third branch of government useless for at least a year.

— Michael Greenberger on the GOP pledge to block President Obama's appointment of a Supreme Court justice to replace Antonin Scalia

article_metadata.fb_title: Roughly Speaking: Supreme Court battle, Bernie Sanders' surprising campaign (episode 53)
article_metadata.author: Baltimore Sun

og.title: Roughly Speaking: Supreme Court battle, Bernie Sanders' surprising campaign (episode 53)

article_metadata.keywords: Supreme Court, Antonin Scalia, Bernie Sanders
article_metadata.Description: Michael Greenberger, who's argued cases before the Supreme court, talks about the looming battle between the president and the Senate, and Michael Reisch, a leading expert on government social policy, gives his views of the presidential candidacy of Bernie Sanders.
article_metadata.news_keywords: Supreme Court, Antonin Scalia, Bernie Sanders

article_summary:
— Michael Greenberger on the GOP pledge to block President Obama's appointment of a Supreme Court justice to replace Antonin Scalia
Mitch McConnell and the Republican candidates are talking about making the third branch of government useless for at least a year.
